Title: Not Quite Lisp
Desc: Santa was hoping for a white Christmas, but his weather machine's "snow" function is powered by stars, and he's fresh out!

Title: I Was Told There Would Be No Math
Desc: The elves are running low on wrapping paper, and so they need to submit an order for more.

Title: Perfectly Spherical Houses in a Vacuum
Desc: Santa is delivering presents to an infinite two-dimensional grid of houses.

Title: The Ideal Stocking Stuffer
Desc: Santa needs help mining some AdventCoins (very similar to bitcoins) to use as gifts for all the economically forward-thinking little girls and boys.

Title: Doesn't He Have Intern-Elves For This?
Desc: Santa needs help figuring out which strings in his text file are naughty or nice.

Title: Probably a Fire Hazard
Desc: Because your neighbors keep defeating you in the holiday house decorating contest year after year, you've decided to deploy one million lights in a 1000x1000 grid.

Title: Some Assembly Required
Desc: This year, Santa brought little Bobby Tables a set of wires and bitwise logic gates!

Title: Matchsticks
Desc: Space on the sleigh is limited this year, and so Santa will be bringing his list as a digital copy.

Title: All in a Single Night
Desc: Every year, Santa manages to deliver all of his presents in a single night.

Title: Elves Look, Elves Say
Desc: Today, the Elves are playing a game called look-and-say.

Title: Corporate Policy
Desc: Santa's previous password expired, and he needs help choosing a new one.

Title: JSAbacusFramework.io
Desc: Santa's Accounting-Elves need help balancing the books after a recent order.

Title: Knights of the Dinner Table
Desc: In years past, the holiday feast with your family hasn't gone so well.

Title: Reindeer Olympics
Desc: This year is the Reindeer Olympics!

Title: Science for Hungry People
Desc: Today, you set out on the task of perfecting your milk-dunking cookie recipe.

Title: Aunt Sue
Desc: Your Aunt Sue has given you a wonderful gift, and you'd like to send her a thank you card.

Title: No Such Thing as Too Much
Desc: The elves bought too much eggnog again - 150 liters this time.

Title: Like a GIF For Your Yard
Desc: After the million lights incident, the fire code has gotten stricter: now, at most ten thousand lights are allowed.

Title: Medicine for Rudolph
Desc: Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer is sick!

Title: Infinite Elves and Infinite Houses
Desc: To keep the Elves busy, Santa has them deliver some presents by hand, door-to-door.

Title: RPG Simulator 20XX
Desc: Little Henry Case got a new video game for Christmas.

Title: Wizard Simulator 20XX
Desc: Little Henry Case decides that defeating bosses with swords and stuff is boring.

Title: Opening the Turing Lock
Desc: Little Jane Marie just got her very first computer for Christmas from some unknown benefactor.

Title: It Hangs in the Balance
Desc: It's Christmas Eve, and Santa is loading up the sleigh for this year's deliveries.

Title: Let It Snow
Desc: Merry Christmas!

Title: No Time for a Taxicab
Desc: Santa's sleigh uses a very high-precision clock to guide its movements, and the clock's oscillator is regulated by stars.

Title: Bathroom Security
Desc: You arrive at Easter Bunny Headquarters under cover of darkness.

Title: Squares With Three Sides
Desc: Now that you can think clearly, you move deeper into the labyrinth of hallways and office furniture that makes up this part of Easter Bunny HQ.

Title: Security Through Obscurity
Desc: Finally, you come across an information kiosk with a list of rooms.

Title: How About a Nice Game of Chess?
Desc: You are faced with a security door designed by Easter Bunny engineers that seem to have acquired most of their security knowledge by watching hackingmovies.

Title: Signals and Noise
Desc: Something is jamming your communications with Santa.

Title: Internet Protocol Version 7
Desc: While snooping around the local network of EBHQ, you compile a list of IP addresses (they're IPv7, of course; IPv6 is much too limited).

Title: Two-Factor Authentication
Desc: You come across a door implementing what you can only assume is an implementation of two-factor authentication after a long game of requirementstelephone.

Title: Explosives in Cyberspace
Desc: Wandering around a secure area, you come across a datalink port to a new part of the network.

Title: Balance Bots
Desc: You come upon a factory in which many robots are zooming around handing small microchips to each other.

Title: Radioisotope Thermoelectric Generators
Desc: You come upon a column of four floors that have been entirely sealed off from the rest of the building except for a small dedicated lobby.

Title: Leonardo's Monorail
Desc: You finally reach the top floor of this building: a garden with a slanted glass ceiling.

Title: A Maze of Twisty Little Cubicles
Desc: You arrive at the first floor of this new building to discover a much less welcoming environment than the shiny atrium of the last one.

Title: One-Time Pad
Desc: In order to communicate securely with Santa while you're on this mission, you've been using a one-time pad that you generate using a pre-agreed algorithm.

Title: Timing is Everything
Desc: The halls open into an interior plaza containing a large kinetic sculpture.

Title: Dragon Checksum
Desc: You're done scanning this part of the network, but you've left traces of your presence.

Title: Two Steps Forward
Desc: You're trying to access a secure vault protected by a 4x4 grid of small rooms connected by doors.

Title: Like a Rogue
Desc: As you enter this room, you hear a loud click!

Title: An Elephant Named Joseph
Desc: The Elves contact you over a highly secure emergency channel.

Title: Firewall Rules
Desc: You'd like to set up a small hidden computer here so you can use it to get back into the network later.

Title: Scrambled Letters and Hash
Desc: The computer system you're breaking into uses a weird scrambling function to store its passwords.

Title: Grid Computing
Desc: You gain access to a massive storage cluster arranged in a grid; each storage node is only connected to the four nodes directly adjacent to it (three if the node is on an edge, two if it's in a corner).

Title: Safe Cracking
Desc: This is one of the top floors of the nicest tower in EBHQ.

Title: Air Duct Spelunking
Desc: You've finally met your match; the doors that provide access to the roof are locked tight, and all of the controls and related electronics are inaccessible.

Title: Clock Signal
Desc: You open the door and find yourself on the roof.

Title: Inverse Captcha
Desc: The night before Christmas, one of Santa's Elves calls you in a panic.

Title: Corruption Checksum
Desc: As you walk through the door, a glowing humanoid shape yells in your direction.

Title: Spiral Memory
Desc: You come across an experimental new kind of memory stored on an infinite two-dimensional grid.

Title: High-Entropy Passphrases
Desc: A new system policy has been put in place that requires all accounts to use a passphrase instead of simply a password.

Title: A Maze of Twisty Trampolines, All Alike
Desc: An urgent interrupt arrives from the CPU: it's trapped in a maze of jump instructions, and it would like assistance from any programs with spare cycles to help find the exit.

Title: Memory Reallocation
Desc: A debugger program here is having an issue: it is trying to repair a memory reallocation routine, but it keeps getting stuck in an infinite loop.

Title: Recursive Circus
Desc: Wandering further through the circuits of the computer, you come upon a tower of programs that have gotten themselves into a bit of trouble.

Title: I Heard You Like Registers
Desc: You receive a signal directly from the CPU.

Title: Stream Processing
Desc: A large stream blocks your path.

Title: Knot Hash
Desc: You come across some programs that are trying to implement a software emulation of a hash based on knot-tying.

Title: Hex Ed
Desc: Crossing the bridge, you've barely reached the other side of the stream when a program comes up to you, clearly in distress.

Title: Digital Plumber
Desc: Walking along the memory banks of the stream, you find a small village that is experiencing a little confusion: some programs can't communicate with each other.

Title: Packet Scanners
Desc: You need to cross a vast firewall.

Title: Disk Defragmentation
Desc: Suddenly, a scheduled job activates the system's disk defragmenter.

Title: Dueling Generators
Desc: Here, you encounter a pair of dueling generators.

Title: Permutation Promenade
Desc: You come upon a very unusual sight; a group of programs here appear to be dancing.

Title: Spinlock
Desc: Suddenly, whirling in the distance, you notice what looks like a massive, pixelated hurricane: a deadly spinlock.

Title: Duet
Desc: You discover a tablet containing some strange assembly code labeled simply "Duet".

Title: A Series of Tubes
Desc: Somehow, a network packet got lost and ended up here.

Title: Particle Swarm
Desc: Suddenly, the GPU contacts you, asking for help.

Title: Fractal Art
Desc: You find a program trying to generate some art.

Title: Sporifica Virus
Desc: Diagnostics indicate that the local grid computing cluster has been contaminated with the Sporifica Virus.

Title: Coprocessor Conflagration
Desc: You decide to head directly to the CPU and fix the printer from there.

Title: Electromagnetic Moat
Desc: The CPU itself is a large, black building surrounded by a bottomless pit.

Title: The Halting Problem
Desc: Following the twisty passageways deeper and deeper into the CPU, you finally reach the core of the computer.

Title: Chronal Calibration
Desc: We've detected some temporal anomalies, one of Santa's Elves at the Temporal Anomaly Research and Detection Instrument Station tells you.

Title: Inventory Management System
Desc: You stop falling through time, catch your breath, and check the screen on the device.

Title: No Matter How You Slice It
Desc: The Elves managed to locate the chimney-squeeze prototype fabric for Santa's suit (thanks to someone who helpfully wrote its box IDs on the wall of the warehouse in the middle of the night).

Title: Repose Record
Desc: You've sneaked into another supply closet - this time, it's across from the prototype suit manufacturing lab.

Title: Alchemical Reduction
Desc: You've managed to sneak in to the prototype suit manufacturing lab.

Title: Chronal Coordinates
Desc: The device on your wrist beeps several times, and once again you feel like you're falling.

Title: The Sum of Its Parts
Desc: You find yourself standing on a snow-covered coastline; apparently, you landed a little off course.

Title: Memory Maneuver
Desc: The sleigh is much easier to pull than you'd expect for something its weight.

Title: Marble Mania
Desc: You talk to the Elves while you wait for your navigation system to initialize.

Title: The Stars Align
Desc: It's no use; your navigation system simply isn't capable of providing walking directions in the arctic circle, and certainly not in 1018.

Title: Chronal Charge
Desc: You watch the Elves and their sleigh fade into the distance as they head toward the North Pole.

Title: Subterranean Sustainability
Desc: The year 518 is significantly more underground than your history books implied.

Title: Mine Cart Madness
Desc: A crop of this size requires significant logistics to transport produce, soil, fertilizer, and so on.

Title: Chocolate Charts
Desc: You finally have a chance to look at all of the produce moving around.

Title: Beverage Bandits
Desc: Having perfected their hot chocolate, the Elves have a new problem: the Goblins that live in these caves will do anything to steal it.

Title: Chronal Classification
Desc: As you see the Elves defend their hot chocolate successfully, you go back to falling through time.

Title: Reservoir Research
Desc: You arrive in the year 18.

Title: Settlers of The North Pole
Desc: On the outskirts of the North Pole base construction project, many Elves are collecting lumber.

Title: Go With The Flow
Desc: With the Elves well on their way constructing the North Pole base, you turn your attention back to understanding the inner workings of programming the device.

Title: A Regular Map
Desc: While you were learning about instruction pointers, the Elves made considerable progress.

Title: Chronal Conversion
Desc: You should have been watching where you were going, because as you wander the new North Pole base, you trip and fall into a very deep hole!

Title: Mode Maze
Desc: This is it, your final stop: the year -483.

Title: Experimental Emergency Teleportation
Desc: Using your torch to search the darkness of the rocky cavern, you finally locate the man's friend: a small reindeer.

Title: Immune System Simulator 20XX
Desc: After a weird buzzing noise, you appear back at the man's cottage.

Title: Four-Dimensional Adventure
Desc: The reindeer's symptoms are getting worse, and neither you nor the white-bearded man have a solution.

Title: The Tyranny of the Rocket Equation
Desc: Santa has become stranded at the edge of the Solar System while delivering presents to other planets!

Title: 1202 Program Alarm
Desc: On the way to your gravity assist around the Moon, your ship computer beeps angrily about a "1202 program alarm".

Title: Crossed Wires
Desc: The gravity assist was successful, and you're well on your way to the Venus refuelling station.

Title: Secure Container
Desc: You arrive at the Venus fuel depot only to discover it's protected by a password.

Title: Sunny with a Chance of Asteroids
Desc: You're starting to sweat as the ship makes its way toward Mercury.

Title: Universal Orbit Map
Desc: You've landed at the Universal Orbit Map facility on Mercury.

Title: Amplification Circuit
Desc: Based on the navigational maps, you're going to need to send more power to your ship's thrusters to reach Santa in time.

Title: Space Image Format
Desc: The Elves' spirits are lifted when they realize you have an opportunity to reboot one of their Mars rovers, and so they are curious if you would spend a brief sojourn on Mars.

Title: Sensor Boost
Desc: You've just said goodbye to the rebooted rover and left Mars when you receive a faint distress signal coming from the asteroid belt.

Title: Monitoring Station
Desc: You fly into the asteroid belt and reach the Ceres monitoring station.

Title: Space Police
Desc: On the way to Jupiter, you're pulled over by the Space Police.

Title: The N-Body Problem
Desc: The space near Jupiter is not a very safe place; you need to be careful of a big distracting red spot, extreme radiation, and a whole lot of moons swirling around.

Title: Care Package
Desc: As you ponder the solitude of space and the ever-increasing three-hour roundtrip for messages between you and Earth, you notice that the Space Mail Indicator Light is blinking.

Title: Space Stoichiometry
Desc: As you approach the rings of Saturn, your ship's low fuel indicator turns on.

Title: Oxygen System
Desc: Out here in deep space, many things can go wrong.

Title: Flawed Frequency Transmission
Desc: You're 3/4ths of the way through the gas giants.

Title: Set and Forget
Desc: An early warning system detects an incoming solar flare and automatically activates the ship's electromagnetic shield.

Title: Many-Worlds Interpretation
Desc: As you approach Neptune, a planetary security system detects you and activates a giant tractor beam on Triton!

Title: Tractor Beam
Desc: Unsure of the state of Santa's ship, you borrowed the tractor beam technology from Triton.

Title: Donut Maze
Desc: You notice a strange pattern on the surface of Pluto and land nearby to get a closer look.

Title: Springdroid Adventure
Desc: You lift off from Pluto and start flying in the direction of Santa.

Title: Slam Shuffle
Desc: There isn't much to do while you wait for the droids to repair your ship.

Title: Category Six
Desc: The droids have finished repairing as much of the ship as they can.

Title: Planet of Discord
Desc: You land on Eris, your last stop before reaching Santa.

Title: Cryostasis
Desc: As you approach Santa's ship, your sensors report two important details:

Title: Report Repair
Desc: After saving Christmas five years in a row, you've decided to take a vacation at a nice resort on a tropical island.

Title: Password Philosophy
Desc: Your flight departs in a few days from the coastal airport; the easiest way down to the coast from here is via toboggan.

Title: Toboggan Trajectory
Desc: With the toboggan login problems resolved, you set off toward the airport.

Title: Passport Processing
Desc: You arrive at the airport only to realize that you grabbed your North Pole Credentials instead of your passport.

Title: Binary Boarding
Desc: You board your plane only to discover a new problem: you dropped your boarding pass!

Title: Custom Customs
Desc: As your flight approaches the regional airport where you'll switch to a much larger plane, customs declaration forms are distributed to the passengers.

Title: Handy Haversacks
Desc: You land at the regional airport in time for your next flight.

Title: Handheld Halting
Desc: Your flight to the major airline hub reaches cruising altitude without incident.

Title: Encoding Error
Desc: With your neighbor happily enjoying their video game, you turn your attention to an open data port on the little screen in the seat in front of you.

Title: Adapter Array
Desc: Patched into the aircraft's data port, you discover weather forecasts of a massive tropical storm.

Title: Seating System
Desc: Your plane lands with plenty of time to spare.

Title: Rain Risk
Desc: Your ferry made decent progress toward the island, but the storm came in faster than anyone expected.

Title: Shuttle Search
Desc: Your ferry can make it safely to a nearby port, but it won't get much further.

Title: Docking Data
Desc: As your ferry approaches the sea port, the captain asks for your help again.

Title: Rambunctious Recitation
Desc: You catch the airport shuttle and try to book a new flight to your vacation island.

Title: Ticket Translation
Desc: As you're walking to yet another connecting flight, you realize that one of the legs of your re-routed trip coming up is on a high-speed train.

Title: Conway Cubes
Desc: As your flight slowly drifts through the sky, the Elves at the Mythical Information Bureau at the North Pole contact you.

Title: Operation Order
Desc: As you look out the window and notice a heavily-forested continent slowly appear over the horizon, you are interrupted by the child sitting next to you.

Title: Monster Messages
Desc: You land in an airport surrounded by dense forest.

Title: Jurassic Jigsaw
Desc: The high-speed train leaves the forest and quickly carries you south.

Title: Allergen Assessment
Desc: You reach the train's last stop and the closest you can get to your vacation island without getting wet.

Title: Crab Combat
Desc: It only takes a few hours of sailing the ocean on a raft for boredom to sink in.

Title: Crab Cups
Desc: The small crab challenges you to a game!

Title: Lobby Layout
Desc: Your raft makes it to the tropical island; it turns out that the small crab was an excellent navigator.

Title: Combo Breaker
Desc: You finally reach the check-in desk.

Title: Sonar Sweep
Desc: You're minding your own business on a ship at sea when the overboard alarm goes off!

Title: Dive!
Desc: Now, you need to figure out how to pilot this thing.

Title: Binary Diagnostic
Desc: The submarine has been making some odd creaking noises, so you ask it to produce a diagnostic report just in case.

Title: Giant Squid
Desc: You're already almost 1.

Title: Hydrothermal Venture
Desc: You come across a field of hydrothermal vents on the ocean floor!

Title: Lanternfish
Desc: The sea floor is getting steeper.

Title: The Treachery of Whales
Desc: A giant whale has decided your submarine is its next meal, and it's much faster than you are.

Title: Seven Segment Search
Desc: You barely reach the safety of the cave when the whale smashes into the cave mouth, collapsing it.

Title: Smoke Basin
Desc: These caves seem to be lava tubes.

Title: Syntax Scoring
Desc: You ask the submarine to determine the best route out of the deep-sea cave, but it only replies:

Title: Dumbo Octopus
Desc: You enter a large cavern full of rare bioluminescent dumbo octopuses!

Title: Passage Pathing
Desc: With your submarine's subterranean subsystems subsisting suboptimally, the only way you're getting out of this cave anytime soon is by finding a path yourself.

Title: Transparent Origami
Desc: You reach another volcanically active part of the cave.

Title: Extended Polymerization
Desc: The incredible pressures at this depth are starting to put a strain on your submarine.

Title: Chiton
Desc: You've almost reached the exit of the cave, but the walls are getting closer together.

Title: Packet Decoder
Desc: As you leave the cave and reach open waters, you receive a transmission from the Elves back on the ship.

Title: Trick Shot
Desc: You finally decode the Elves' message.

Title: Snailfish
Desc: You descend into the ocean trench and encounter some snailfish.

Title: Beacon Scanner
Desc: As your probe drifted down through this area, it released an assortment of beacons and scanners into the water.

Title: Trench Map
Desc: With the scanners fully deployed, you turn their attention to mapping the floor of the ocean trench.

Title: Dirac Dice
Desc: There's not much to do as you slowly descend to the bottom of the ocean.

Title: Reactor Reboot
Desc: Operating at these extreme ocean depths has overloaded the submarine's reactor; it needs to be rebooted.

Title: Amphipod
Desc: A group of amphipods notice your fancy submarine and flag you down.

Title: Arithmetic Logic Unit
Desc: Magic smoke starts leaking from the submarine's arithmetic logic unit (ALU).

Title: Sea Cucumber
Desc: This is it: the bottom of the ocean trench, the last place the sleigh keys could be.

Title: Calorie Counting
Desc: Santa's reindeer typically eat regular reindeer food, but they need a lot of magical energy to deliver presents on Christmas.

Title: Rock Paper Scissors
Desc: The Elves begin to set up camp on the beach.

Title: Rucksack Reorganization
Desc: One Elf has the important job of loading all of the rucksacks with supplies for the jungle journey.

Title: Camp Cleanup
Desc: Space needs to be cleared before the last supplies can be unloaded from the ships, and so several Elves have been assigned the job of cleaning up sections of the camp.

Title: Supply Stacks
Desc: The expedition can depart as soon as the final supplies have been unloaded from the ships.

Title: Tuning Trouble
Desc: The preparations are finally complete; you and the Elves leave camp on foot and begin to make your way toward the star fruit grove.

Title: No Space Left On Device
Desc: You can hear birds chirping and raindrops hitting leaves as the expedition proceeds.

Title: Treetop Tree House
Desc: The expedition comes across a peculiar patch of tall trees all planted carefully in a grid.

Title: Rope Bridge
Desc: This rope bridge creaks as you walk along it.

Title: Cathode-Ray Tube
Desc: You avoid the ropes, plunge into the river, and swim to shore.

Title: Monkey in the Middle
Desc: As you finally start making your way upriver, you realize your pack is much lighter than you remember.

Title: Hill Climbing Algorithm
Desc: You try contacting the Elves using your handheld device, but the river you're following must be too low to get a decent signal.

Title: Distress Signal
Desc: You climb the hill and again try contacting the Elves.

Title: Regolith Reservoir
Desc: The distress signal leads you to a giant waterfall!

Title: Beacon Exclusion Zone
Desc: You feel the ground rumble again as the distress signal leads you to a large network of subterranean tunnels.

Title: Proboscidea Volcanium
Desc: The sensors have led you to the origin of the distress signal: yet another handheld device, just like the one the Elves gave you.

Title: Pyroclastic Flow
Desc: Your handheld device has located an alternative exit from the cave for you and the elephants.

Title: Boiling Boulders
Desc: You and the elephants finally reach fresh air.

Title: Not Enough Minerals
Desc: Your scans show that the lava did indeed form obsidian!

Title: Grove Positioning System
Desc: It's finally time to meet back up with the Elves.

Title: Monkey Math
Desc: The monkeys are back!

Title: Monkey Map
Desc: The monkeys take you on a surprisingly easy trail through the jungle.

Title: Unstable Diffusion
Desc: You enter a large crater of gray dirt where the grove is supposed to be.

Title: Blizzard Basin
Desc: With everything replanted for next year (and with elephants and monkeys to tend the grove), you and the Elves leave for the extraction point.

Title: Full of Hot Air
Desc: As the expedition finally reaches the extraction point, several large hot air balloons drift down to meet you.

Title: Trebuchet?!
Desc: Something is wrong with global snow production, and you've been selected to take a look.

Title: Cube Conundrum
Desc: You're launched high into the atmosphere!

Title: Gear Ratios
Desc: You and the Elf eventually reach a gondola lift station; he says the gondola lift will take you up to the water source, but this is as far as he can bring you.

Title: Scratchcards
Desc: The gondola takes you up.

Title: If You Give A Seed A Fertilizer
Desc: You take the boat and find the gardener right where you were told he would be: managing a giant "garden" that looks more to you like a farm.

Title: Wait For It
Desc: The ferry quickly brings you across Island Island.

Title: Camel Cards
Desc: Your all-expenses-paid trip turns out to be a one-way, five-minute ride in an airship.

Title: Haunted Wasteland
Desc: You're still riding a camel across Desert Island when you spot a sandstorm quickly approaching.

Title: Mirage Maintenance
Desc: You ride the camel through the sandstorm and stop where the ghost's maps told you to stop.

Title: Pipe Maze
Desc: You use the hang glider to ride the hot air from Desert Island all the way up to the floating metal island.

Title: Cosmic Expansion
Desc: You continue following signs for "Hot Springs" and eventually come across an observatory.

Title: Hot Springs
Desc: You finally reach the hot springs!

Title: Point of Incidence
Desc: With your help, the hot springs team locates an appropriate spring which launches you neatly and precisely up to the edge of Lava Island.

Title: Parabolic Reflector Dish
Desc: You reach the place where all of the mirrors were pointing: a massive parabolic reflector dishattached to the side of another large mountain.

Title: Lens Library
Desc: The newly-focused parabolic reflector dish is sending all of the collected light to a point on the side of yet another mountain - the largest mountain on Lava Island.

Title: The Floor Will Be Lava
Desc: With the beam of light completely focused somewhere, the reindeer leads you deeper still into the Lava Production Facility.

Title: Clumsy Crucible
Desc: The lava starts flowing rapidly once the Lava Production Facility is operational.

Title: Lavaduct Lagoon
Desc: Thanks to your efforts, the machine parts factory is one of the first factories up and running since the lavafall came back.

Title: Aplenty
Desc: The Elves of Gear Island are thankful for your help and send you on your way.

Title: Pulse Propagation
Desc: With your help, the Elves manage to find the right parts and fix all of the machines.

Title: Step Counter
Desc: You manage to catch the airship right as it's dropping someone else off on their all-expenses-paid trip to Desert Island!

Title: Sand Slabs
Desc: Enough sand has fallen; it can finally filter water for Snow Island.

Title: A Long Walk
Desc: The Elves resume water filtering operations!

Title: Never Tell Me The Odds
Desc: It seems like something is going wrong with the snow-making process.

Title: Snowverload
Desc: Still somehow without snow, you go to the last place you haven't checked: the center of Snow Island, directly below the waterfall.

Title: Historian Hysteria
Desc: The Chief Historian is always present for the big Christmas sleigh launch, but nobody has seen him in months!

Title: Red-Nosed Reports
Desc: Fortunately, the first location The Historians want to search isn't a long walk from the Chief Historian's office.

Title: Mull It Over
Desc:
Our computers are having issues, so I have no idea if we have any Chief Historians in stock!|https://adventofcode.com/2024/day/3
2024|4|Ceres Search|Looks like the Chief's not here.

Title: Print Queue
Desc: Satisfied with their search on Ceres, the squadron of scholars suggests subsequently scanning the stationery stacks of sub-basement 17.

Title: Guard Gallivant
Desc: The Historians use their fancy device again, this time to whisk you all away to the North Pole prototype suit manufacturing lab.

Title: Bridge Repair
Desc: The Historians take you to a familiar rope bridge over a river in the middle of a jungle.

Title: Resonant Collinearity
Desc: You find yourselves on the roof of a top-secret Easter Bunny installation.

Title: Disk Fragmenter
Desc: Another push of the button leaves you in the familiar hallways of some friendly amphipods!

Title: Hoof It
Desc: You all arrive at a Lava Production Facility on a floating island in the sky.

Title: Plutonian Pebbles
Desc: The ancient civilization on Pluto was known for its ability to manipulate spacetime, and while The Historians explore their infinite corridors, you've noticed a strange set of physics-defying stones.

Title: Garden Groups
Desc: Why not search for the Chief Historian near the gardener and his massive farm? There's plenty of food, so The Historians grab something to eat while they search.

Title: Claw Contraption
Desc: Next up: the lobby of a resort on a tropical island.

Title: Restroom Redoubt
Desc: One of The Historians needs to use the bathroom; fortunately, you know there's a bathroom near an unvisited location on their list, and so you're all quickly teleported directly to the lobby of Easter Bunny Headquarters.

Title: Warehouse Woes
Desc: You appear back inside your own mini submarine!

Title: Reindeer Maze
Desc: It's time again for the Reindeer Olympics!

Title: Chronospatial Computer
Desc: The Historians push the button on their strange device, but this time, you all just feel like you're falling.

Title: RAM Run
Desc: You and The Historians look a lot more pixelated than you remember.

Title: Linen Layout
Desc: Today, The Historians take you up to the hot springs on Gear Island!

Title: Race Condition
Desc: The Historians are quite pixelated again.

Title: Keypad Conundrum
Desc: As you teleport onto Santa's Reindeer-class starship, The Historians begin to panic: someone from their search party is missing.

Title: Monkey Market
Desc: As you're all teleported deep into the jungle, a monkey steals The Historians' device!

Title: LAN Party
Desc: As The Historians wander around a secure area at Easter Bunny HQ, you come across posters for a LAN party scheduled for today!

Title: Crossed Wires
Desc: You and The Historians arrive at the edge of a large grove somewhere in the jungle.

Title: Code Chronicle
Desc: Out of ideas and time, The Historians agree that they should go back to check the Chief Historian's office one last time, just in case he went back there without you noticing.
